article_title: Don't expand Alaska's Medicaid system until it's been reformed
article_text: Gov. Sean Parnell resisted expansion, saying he did not trust the federal government to keep its word to pay 90 percent of the costs for the first few years -- and who could blame him? -- but Walker injected the issue into his election campaign for the state's top post, saying it would bring 4,000 jobs and zillions of federal dollars to the state. It was blue sky, of course, but it paid off on Election Day.

article_metadata.description: OPINION: Alaska's Medicaid system is so messed up that no one knows exactly how bad the problem is. That's reason enough to not expand the system until it can be reformed.
